intro: Luzula macrocarpa var. laxa, commonly known as the looseleaf woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered spikes of white to pale blue flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread and form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
